sentences.sContent: ...lifelong marriages can be promoted by practices such as the cultural prohibition of divorce and arranged marriages that are seen as a contract between two families...
...The editor is amazed at how quickly Smith gets his stories only minutes after they happen - but soon he's presented with a contract to sign...
...my contract wasn't renewed and I plunged further into new depths of ill health...
...Not long before my contract was due to be made permanent...
...One of the best things my company has done is to contract with a language service that offers translations over the phone...
...I’d like to go over all the articles of the contract once more before signing it...

phrases.pCn: 签订合同；签合同；签署合同
社会契约（统治者与被统治者订定的详列权利义务的契约，等于social 社会契约论；compact）；民约论

remMethod.val: con(共同) ＋ tract(拉， 拽) → 合同将双方损益拉到一起 → 契约， 合同

words.tran: 合约地；合同性地；契约规定地

trans.tranCn: 缩小； 订合同； 感染， 染上
trans.tranOther: to sign a contract in which you agree formally that you will do something or someone will do something for you
an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do
